reviewText: This is actually a second copy, because husband managed to misplace the first one.  He was very unhappy over the loss, so this was a replacement.  He is particularly fond of the arrangements of some of the songs in here that are different from what appeared on the CDs.  Both performers are in good voice and are appealing, and the songs are a varied collection.  It was worth replacing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great collabration concert that Mark Knopfler and EmmyLou Harris has created. Both are very talented musicians, and collectively they are even better. The entire concert is outstanding.Musicians include: Mark Knopfler and EmmyLou Harris on guitars and vocals (Mark plays electric guitar, EmmyLou plays acoustic); Guy Fletcher on keyboards; Richard Bennett on guitar; Danny Cummings on drums; Stuart Duncan on fiddle and mandolin; Matt Rollings on keyboards; and Glen Work on bass. In the concert Mark introduces the band members and refers to them as "world class" musicians. I agree with that assessment.The dvd begins with EmmyLou discussing what brought the two musicians together. Then you get Mark Knopfler's band rehearing.The entire concert is outstanding but some highlights include: "Red Staggerwing" ; "Red Dirt Girl"; "Done with Bonaparte"; "Song for Sonny Listen"; "Belle Star" "All the Roardrunning"; "Boulder to Birmingham" (this is an EmmyLou classic that is a tribute to the late Gram Parsons, whom she used to perform and record with); "Speedway to Nazareth"; "So far Away" ; and "Our Shangri-La"This is a 5 star concert dvd, that is destined to become a classic. I highly recommend it.
summary: Mark Knopfler and EmmyLou Harris "Real Live Roadrunning"

reviewText: The DVD is great quality.Unfortunately I was sent region #2 so it did not play on my DVD players.the case said region 2-6 but the Amazon product details did not identify any region limitations.I had to enter a special code to get region free operation to work on one DVD player and then I could view the DVD.Before I found this work around to fix the issue, I sent the seller an e-mail identifying the problem and never got a reponse.I submitted feedback and still got no response from the seller although I noticed a response is posted - they just never bothered to send me a copy.So apparently not only do you have to be careful about region code when making a purchase, you have to check the box for region code BEFORE opening the package!  Once you open the DVD - it's all yours...---->"DVD arrived promptly, but was region 2-6 not region #1 for play in the USA. I immediately reported this problem to caimanoutlet. After 2 weeks I have had no reply."Date: 7/6/2008  Rated by Buyer: stvmarthSeller Response: "Thank you for your feedback. Please be advised that all DVDs coded for Region 2 (Japan, Europe, South Africa, & the Middle East, including Egypt) are identified in the product details on the Amazon.com listing. To verify that you are purchasing the correct region code, please check the product details page and review the DVD packaging upon receipt of your purchase before opening the packaging."  Date: 7/7/2008
summary: Great audio and video - nice if you like country music
Title: N/A

reviewText: Mark Knopfler and Emmylou Harris give us the best of their ALL THE ROADRUNNING tour in this concert DVD.With two of my favorite musicians working together, expectations couldn't help but be high. I needn't have worried. Not only are these two artists giving their best, but they're backed by a band second to none.Even better is that the concert didn't restrict itself to only songs from the ALL THE ROADRUNNING CD. Also included are gems from past albums by both Emmylou and Mark. Some songs, like the classic "Boulder to Birmingham," don't work for me as well as the originals, but I'm just picking nits.I do wish Knopfler had extended himself more on guitar, as he did in the Soundstage version of these concerts. He's too much a gentleman, I guess, to hog the show. When he does take the lead, the excitement audibly goes up, and when he's done you're certain he stopped too soon.This is a marvelous concert, and my favorite in a fairly large collection. Be sure to play it through your stereo, not just from the TV and, as my dear wife says when I ask if I can crank up the volume, "Shake the walls!"
Title: N/A
